page.title: 13Waingels Copse Comprehensive
page.content: {Waingels}is a comprehensive school for 11 to 18 year olds. Its got its name from{Wangeling the Targ.}People raced in barrels down the River Loddon. Mr Marks, the head teacher, said it was misspelt to Waingels. Mr Marks thinks that{comprehensive education}is an opportunity for all children to do their best. In{September, 1985 Waingels will have over{1300 pupils. The approximate intake each year is {240.}Building started in 1969 and is still continuing. They have{5 units:_ Technical; Music; A Block; Creative Block and Terrapin. Eventually a five_ a_side football pitch is hoped for and more tennis courts. The school day starts at 8.50a.m. and ends at 3.30p.m with after school clubs.{Competitions are entered for by the pupils. These include music and sport among many others.
